text: The Council for Mutual Economic Assistance (COMECON) was an economic organization from 1949 to 1991 under the leadership of the Soviet Union that consisted of Eastern Bloc countries along with other socialist states all over the world. Comecon was set up to stop countries in the Soviet sphere of influence from moving towards that of the capitalist United States and the West. Comecon was how the Eastern Bloc responded to the Marshall Plan of the United States. ==References== Category:1949 establishments Category:1991 disestablishments Category:20th century in Vietnam Category:Cold War Category:Economic history Category:Economics organizations Category:20th century in Europe Category:History of the Soviet Union Category:Politics of the Soviet Union Category:Socialism
title: Council for Mutual Economic Assistance
